oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ambrotype of Capt. Ben H. Sandeford
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cased ambrotype of Capt. (Maj.) Ben H. Sandeford, Co. H., 12th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, also known as the "Gibson Stars." Sandeford, a native of Jackson, Tenn., was killed in action on April 6, 1862, at Shiloh. In the portrait, he is standing and wears a frock coat adorned with four stars on the collar and silk sash around his waist. He is holding a sheathed sword and has a Colt revolver in his belt. His sword belt has an oval buckle.
